item.title: Nested list item indent
item.description:
Many modern browsers indent list items 40 pixels by default.

When a nested list contains more three or more levels, the default indent becomes more pronounced.

You can use padding-inline-start to control this, as shown in the following examples:

item.title: Simple newspaper columns
item.description:
Use the column-width property to display lists in columns that flow like newspaper stories.

Here’s an example:

  • Abyssinian
  • American Shorthair
  • Arabian Mau
  • Bengal
  • Calico
  • Chartreux
  • Himalayan
  • Korat
  • Maine Coon
  • Manx
  • Minuet
  • Norwegian Forest Cat
  • Persian
  • Ragdoll
  • Siamese
  • Snowshoe
  • Tortoiseshell
  • York Chocolate

To learn more, including how to style the columns, see Multiple-column layout (Mozilla developer).

Inline examples
